text: Thank you for your reply Jon. If you had a client that wanted a new newsletter template, would you recommend they use the drag/drop builder and if further customization is needed wait for the new template functionality to be released?

Completely depends on the needs of the client. If they need a very custom looking email and it can’t be built in the drag n drop emails yet, then I would build a custom template. The email templates we build now, will not suddenly become useless when they update the design manager side. The new emails may be like upgrading custom modules was when DM2 came out, but the old templates will still work.

Another option but may not give you the level of control you need. You can also create custom modules to use in the new drag n drop email builder, for the layouts and whatnot that can’t currently be achieved by it
On a unrelated note, did you get a new hairstyle? I noticed some new growth.... it looks good.
with your other option using custom modules that might work. Can you save the email built as a template or would they need to clone the campaign each time?
they would need to clone each time
haha. So you must have had the hair all along and I never noticed it. Thanks for all of your help. Have a good day.
I stole :will: ’s hair right around the April 1st. I’ll set it back eventually lol
